metadata.titel_preek: Trinity Sunday and Psalm 130: Out of the Depths

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God, whose nature is self-giving love, pursues and redeems humanity from a state of total self-destruction and 'primordial catastrophe' despite human resistance and unworthiness.

subject.identificatie: The Triune God (Father, Son, Holy Spirit)
tekstueel_bewijs: God pursues us even beyond the grave
The God who can redeem humanity from so grave a predicament
God’s love spends itself to the very last drop

object.identificatie: Redemption and Restoration of the 'Miserable Offender'

zender.identificatie: The Triune Nature of God (Inner core of Being)
tekstueel_bewijs: The inmost being of God is a dynamic interrelatedness that pours itself out

ontvanger.identificatie: The 'Miserable Offender' / The Church / The Hearer
tekstueel_bewijs: he shall redeem Israel from all his iniquities

helper.identificatie: The Grace of Christ / The Holy Spirit / Human 'hints' (parents/teachers)
tekstueel_bewijs: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ
That person has conveyed to you a measure of the love of God
helper.rol_van_god: God is Subject, not merely Helper
helper.rol_van_geest: External help that breaks through resistance

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin as Cosmic Power / Self-Destruction / Human Resistance
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Sin is described not as a mistake but as an ontological 'catastrophe' and 'estrangement' that renders the human Subject totally powerless.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human response of confession and 'fear of the Lord' as an entrance into the larger life of God.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer / The Psalmist
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The human action (confession) is a response to the realization of God's prior character (forgiveness).

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: Triune Love → Redemption → The Miserable Offender

voorbeelden_god_subject: God pursues us even beyond the grave
The love of God bears all things
voorbeelden_mens_subject: The psalmist ceases to reflect upon himself

voorbeelden: things which we ought to have done
recognize that sin is not breaking rules
understand what is meant here by the fear of the Lord
total inability to present ourselves righteous

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the human lack of 'Pouvoir' (power) and God's absolute 'Pouvoir' to save. It is a theology of total inability met by total divine capacity.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from S2 (Depths) through ~S1 (rejection of self-merit) to S1 (Grace), resulting in ~S2 (Fear of the Lord/Deliverance).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is found in the character of God (S1) which exists even when the human is at S2.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; S2 is described as a 'vast primordial catastrophe'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon consistently places God as the active Subject of salvation. Human action is limited to the 'passive' act of confession and receiving.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Imagine for a moment that you are the parent...

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: It is not dependent on the worthiness of the other
there is no health in us

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Paul is used as an example of parental agony, but this is immediately linked to God's own character rather than a command for the hearer to 'be like Paul'.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides this: Paul's love is a 'hint' of God's love.

identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic undertones; salvation is entirely God's work.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'depths' of sin to the 'heights' of the Trinity is logically bridged by the character of God as self-giving love.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'fear of the Lord' and 'joyous knowledge'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: God’s love spends itself to the very last drop of the blood of the Son.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is the 'fellowship' that breaks through resistance.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Critical; sin is an 'impulse toward self-destruction' that humans cannot stop.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a textbook example of a theocentric narrative where God is the Subject and the human is the Receiver.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is appropriate for a grace-oriented sermon.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon masterfully avoids the trap of 'exemplarism' by grounding human analogies in the ontological reality of the Trinity.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis might focus on the 'parent' pathos; Greimassian analysis shows this is actually a functional 'Helper' role pointing to the Divine Subject.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Greek/Hebrew; semiotics explains how the sermon 'works' on the hearer's identity.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the sermon's power comes from the 'Subject-switch' where the hearer's inability is replaced by God's capacity.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'miserable offender' language to heighten the 'Opponent' actant, thereby magnifying the 'Subject' (God).
